channel.title: Understanding coordinates
channel.description:
I'm trying to make a FunPK zone on my PI based RSPS. Okay, I'm ripping this code off of IntdubPK, they have a fun PK spot and its PI.
I got this so far, but I don't understand it... Can somebody help explain the X and Y?
safe if(absX > 2582 && absX < 2602 && absY > 3152 && absY < 3171 left safe right safe bottom safe top
funpk absX > 2601 && absX < 2607 && absY > 3156 && absY < 3171) ???
Thanks, and yeah, I reposted this, I really need help on this.

item.title: Understanding coordinates
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

ytuio9:

Safe bottom and safe top, yes. You can obviously create your own zones by changing these co-ords around.

Thanks, I love you even more now.

Edited, I have a question :o


Let’s say I want to make this bank a safe zone.
If the X coordinate of the top left corner was 3845 and the Y coordinate was 4348, the bottom left X coord was 1473, Y was 8234, the top right coord was 6437, the Y bottom right coordinate was 7239, the bottom X coord was 1127 and the top was 14484 … how would I make that safe?

Read full topic

item.title: Understanding coordinates
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

Safe bottom and safe top, yes. You can obviously create your own zones by changing these co-ords around.

Read full topic

item.title: Understanding coordinates
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

So then the bottom is the wilderness?

Read full topic

item.title: Understanding coordinates
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:


basically says if you are between any of these co-ordinates, you are in a safe zone. first absX and absY are your south-west co-ordinates, second ones are your north west co-ordinates.

basically says if you are between any of these co-ordinates, you are in a safe zone. first absX and absY are your south-west co-ordinates, second ones are your north west co-ordinates.

Read full topic

item.title: Understanding coordinates
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

I’m trying to make a FunPK zone on my PI based RSPS.
Okay, I’m ripping this code off of IntdubPK, they have a fun PK spot and its PI.

I got this so far, but I don’t understand it… Can somebody help explain the X and Y?

safe	if(absX > 2582 && absX < 2602 && absY > 3152 && absY < 3171
	              left              safe right         safe bottom        safe top

funpk	absX > 2601 && absX < 2607 && absY > 3156 && absY < 3171)
	        ???

Thanks, and yeah, I reposted this, I really need help on this.

Read full topic
